page.title: 16Housing in Linslade
page.content: Across the border in Linslade (Bedfordshire) two estates of houses have been developed since 1965. The larger of these is Southcott village and consists of approximately 1,700 individually designed private houses, detached or semi-detached. Also including are four blocks of purpose built flats, catering for single persons and young married couples. This estate is still being developed with planning permission currently being sought for a further 500 homes. On the approach to the urban area of Leighton Buzzard there are 200 small terraced houses built in the late 1800's, most of which have been done up with the help of Council grants. There are 50-60 houses owned by Bedfordshire County Council including a block of flats for Senior Citizens.
